intro: Siphocampylus cordatus, commonly known as the heartleaf siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value is due to its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
